title: Day One of Painting the Commission

screenplay.rawText:
EXT. JASON’S ART STUDIO - DAY
Jason sets up to paint outside using exploding spray paint cans as an underpainting technique. Stacey films as he detonates multiple cans onto a fresh 48x60 canvas.
actions: Jason prepares an outdoor painting area.
Stacey finishes setting up her documentary camera gear.
Jason smashes spray paint cans onto an exposed nail, causing them to explode paint across the canvas.
Can after can bursts open, coating the entire surface with a chaotic underpainting.
Stacey circles the setup capturing different angles.
Jason finishes the process and examines the results proudly.

lines: Good timing. I’m just about to start painting.
I like to start with a colorfield for the first layer..
I think that’s it.. ..What do you think?
What is it that you’re doing here?

narrative.summary: Jason begins the first day of his painting process by creating an explosive underpainting using spray paint cans detonated on a nail. Stacey documents the unusual method.
narrative.beatPurpose: Show Jason’s artistic process; demonstrate commitment to the contract; establish the documentary’s tone as hands-on and intimate.
narrative.conflict: None directly, but subtle pressure: the two-week deadline is now active.
narrative.stakes: Jason must begin strong to hit the tight commission timeline; this is Day One of the two-week challenge.
narrative.outcome: Jason completes his first layer; Stacey captures successful footage.

locations: Jason’s Art Studio exterior painting area
